intro: Dampiera bicolor, commonly known as the silverleaf dampiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, white flowers and silver-blue foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. It has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery coating, giving it a distinctive appearance. Dampiera bicolor is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
